001package fr.aumgn.dac2.game;
002
003import java.lang.reflect.Array;
004import java.util.LinkedList;
005import java.util.List;
006import java.util.Random;
007
008import fr.aumgn.bukkitutils.util.Util;
009
010public class GameParty<T extends GamePlayer> {
011
012    // Come on..
013    private final Class<T> clazz;
014    private final Game game;
015    private T[] players;
016    private int turn;
017
018    public GameParty(Game game, Class<T> clazz, List<T> list) {
019        this.clazz = (Class<T>) clazz;
020        this.game = game;
021        players = newArray(list.size());
022
023        LinkedList<T> roulette = new LinkedList<T>(list);
024        Random rand = Util.getRandom();
025        for (int i = 0; i< players.length; i++) {
026            int j = rand.nextInt(roulette.size());
027            T player = roulette.remove(j);
028            players[i] = player;
029            player.setIndex(i);
030        }
031
032        turn = -1;
033    }
034
035    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
036    private T[] newArray(int size) {
037        return (T[]) Array.newInstance(clazz, size);
038    }
039
040    public boolean isTurn(T player) {
041        return player.getIndex() == turn;
042    }
043
044    public boolean isLastTurn() {
045        return turn == players.length - 1;
046    }
047
048    public T getCurrent() {
049        return players[turn];
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Returns the internal array used to store the players.
054     * This array is accessible for performance reason
055     * (and because Java doesn't permit polymorphic management of arrays)
056     * and should preferably not be used to modify the array in any way.
057     */
058    public T[] iterable() {
059        return players;
060    }
061
062    public int size() {
063        return players.length;
064    }
065
066    public T nextTurn() {
067        incrementTurn();
068        return players[turn];
069    }
070
071    private void incrementTurn() {
072        turn++;
073        if (turn >= players.length) {
074            turn = 0;
075            game.onNewTurn();
076        }
077    }
078
079    public void removePlayer(T player) {
080        int index = player.getIndex();
081
082        T[] newPlayers = newArray(players.length - 1);
083        System.arraycopy(players, 0, newPlayers, 0, index);
084        System.arraycopy(players, index + 1, newPlayers,
085                index, players.length - index - 1);
086
087        for (int i = index + 1; i < players.length; i++) {
088            players[i].setIndex(i - 1);
089        }
090
091        if (index <= turn) {
092            if (turn == 0) {
093                turn = players.length - 2;
094            } else {
095                turn--;
096            }
097        }
098
099        players = newPlayers;
100    }
101}
